text:
Q: How to reliably prevent screenshots on iOS in Kotlin Multiplatform (Compose Multiplatform)? A:

You'd need to implement UIViewController in the iOS source-set, to deal with the problematic situations, as described. One just has to put it into the correct source-set, as no other platform knows about it (similar to Android). For example: https://medium.com/@lakshimi.cg/screenshot-prevention-in-ios-f059dc82b046 ...also on GitHub.

Q: Apache PDFBox uses ~1.6 GB RAM to render a 1-page scanned PDF — should I optimize Java or switch to PyMuPDF (Python)? A:

  1. There is no "best practice" for this.

  2. Any of the approaches you listed is "reasonable". (For some definitions of reasonable ...)

  3. I don't think you have provided enough information to <strike>determine</strike> predict which approach will give you the overall "best" outcome. Not least because you haven't told us how you prioritize the relevant factors you are optimizing for; e.g. RAM usage, CPU usage, programmer time, time to deliver a working product, cost (of using an external service or buying software licenses for 3rd party products), etcetera.

For instance ... the simplest approach is to provision a server with sufficient RAM to support the workload.

Q: VS Code weird lines in terminal when running code A:

This message is not an error; it's the gdb execution command used internally by the VS Code C++ extension during debugging/execution, output to the terminal. There's no problem with the program's operation, and if you want pure execution, compile/execute it directly from the terminal, not the debugger, and it won't appear.

Q: How do I find an intent to get me as close to "Encryption & credentials" in Settings? A:

xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Q: How do I load a package without installing it in R? A:

To add to previous answer, notice that

devtools::load_all("path/to/mypkg")

will export into the global namespace also functions not marked for export within the package (i.e. functions without the @export tag, i.e. internal functions of the package that are not supposed to be used by the user).

If you want to export only functions marked for export, use export_all=FALSE:

devtools::load_all("path/to/mypkg", export_all=FALSE)

See the docs of devtools::load_all.

Q: survcheck: 'x' must be an array of at least two dimensions A:

Looks like a bug which is now fixed

Q: Thread safe initialisation of function-scoped static variables in C11 A:

If you are referring to C11 mtx_t, this provides acquire/release. From https://en.cppreference.com/w/c/thread/mtx_lock.html

Prior calls to mtx_unlock on the same mutex synchronize-with this operation, and all lock/unlock operations on any given mutex form a single total order (similar to the modification order of an atomic)

However, as you point out, lack of static initialization means that mtx_t cannot be used here.
